# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, I can write the function in Julia language like this:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str)
    result = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width 
            # If the next addition of a space and word exceeds the text width, append a newline
            result *= "\n"
        else 
            # Otherwise, just add the word to the result string with a space in between
            result *= " $word"
        end
    end
    
    return result
end
```
Here is an example of how you can use this function:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed nonne quamquam"
println(wrap_string(text))
```
This would output a string where each line is no longer than 10 characters. It breaks the string into words and adds new lines at word boundaries so that each line contains at most 10 characters.
